content:
• Thursday, November 10, 2011
  • MCPIQ

    Molycorp (MCP) Q3 misses across the board as earnings growth fell slightly below Street...

    Molycorp (MCP) Q3 misses across the board as earnings growth fell slightly below Street expectations. Net sales surged 39% Y/Y to a record level on strong volume, but the company cuts its FY11 production estimates due to recent concerns over pricing volatility. Shares -8.7% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:45 PM | 2 Comments
  • EVOL

    Software and service provider Evolving Systems (NASDAQ:EVOL) jumps in the post-trading session...

    Software and service provider Evolving Systems (NASDAQ:EVOL) jumps in the post-trading session after announcing a one-time, $2.00 special cash dividend to shareholders totalling around $22M. Shares +6% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:19 PM | 2 Comments
  • AVT

    Avnet (NASDAQ:AVT) agrees to buy computer logistics firm Pinnacle Data Systems (NYSEMKT:PNS) in...

    Avnet (NASDAQ:AVT) agrees to buy computer logistics firm Pinnacle Data Systems (NYSEMKT:PNS) in an all cash deal for $22M, equating to $2.40 per share. PNS +100% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:05 PM
  • RENN

    Renren (NYSE:RENN), sometimes called "the Facebook of China," drops 11% AH after reporting Q3...

    Renren (NYSE:RENN), sometimes called "the Facebook of China," drops 11% AH after reporting Q3 revenue of $34.2M (+57% Y/Y) and breakeven EPS, missing consensus by $0.9M and a penny. Ad revenue rose 92% Y/Y to $19.6M, and gaming revenue rose 24% to $11M. Renren is guiding for Q4 revenue of $31M-$33M, below a $35M consensus.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:38 PM | 1 Comment
  • SSRI

    Silver Standard Resources (SSRI -21%) joins fellow silver miners PAAS, AG, and MFN in falling...

    Silver Standard Resources (SSRI -21%) joins fellow silver miners PAAS, AG, and MFN in falling this week after posting Q3 results (I, II, III), only moreso. The company reported EPS of $0.27, beating consensus by $0.15, but it lowered its resource and reserve estimates for a major Argentine silver and zinc mine.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:59 PM | 1 Comment
  • NVDA

    More on Nvidia's (NASDAQ:NVDA) FQ3: Gross margin up 60 bps during quarter, expected to be flat...

    More on Nvidia's (NASDAQ:NVDA) FQ3: Gross margin up 60 bps during quarter, expected to be flat to up 0.5% in FQ4. PC graphics chip sales +1% Y/Y (60% of total), hurt by drop in motherboard chipset sales. Workstation chips +10% Y/Y (22% of total). Consumer products (includes mobile) +14% Y/Y (18% of total). 3 new Tegra-based smartphones launched in FQ3, bringing total to 11. NVDA +5.5% AH. (PR) (CFO comments - PDF)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:36 PM
  • GMCR

    The day's trading comes to a merciful end for Green Mountain Coffee (GMCR -39%), and some...

    The day's trading comes to a merciful end for Green Mountain Coffee (GMCR -39%), and some analysts find the stock's crash inexplicable. Roth Capital's Anton Brenner calls the market’s reaction “ridiculous": Changes in some retailer inventory levels can be traced to K-Cup price increases; "if so, this implies absolutely nothing regarding future sales trends."

     
     
     
     
    | 4:27 PM | 7 Comments
  • NVDA

    Nvidia (NASDAQ:NVDA): FQ3 EPS of $0.35 beats by $0.09. Revenue of $1.07B (+5% Y/Y) beats by...

    Nvidia (NASDAQ:NVDA): FQ3 EPS of $0.35 beats by $0.09. Revenue of $1.07B (+5% Y/Y) beats by $10M. Company expects FQ4 revenue to be "relatively flat, plus or minus 2%." Consensus is for 1% increase. Shares +5.1% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:23 PM
  • JWN

    More on Nordstrom (NYSE:JWN): Q3 beats across the board on strong top-line sales performance...

    More on Nordstrom (NYSE:JWN): Q3 beats across the board on strong top-line sales performance from all channels. Net sales increased by 9% Y/Y, while same-store sales improved by 8.5%. The company cuts its FY11 EPS guidance however, due to an increase retail SG&A expenses related to its acquisition of HauteLook. It now expects to earn between $3.05 - $3.10 per share, below Street expectations of $3.14. Shares -3.8% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:22 PM
  • ETFC

    E-Trade (NASDAQ:ETFC) concludes its review of strategic alternatives, deciding to do nothing...

    E-Trade (NASDAQ:ETFC) concludes its review of strategic alternatives, deciding to do nothing other than "continuing to execute on our strategy designed to create value for both our stockholders and our customers." Shares had received a bit of a bid recently on hope of a sale. After falling 3.5% during the regular session, the stock is off another 3% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:15 PM | 3 Comments
  • JWN

    Nordstrom (NYSE:JWN): Q3 EPS of $0.59 beats by $0.06. Revenue of $2.48B (+14.2% Y/Y) beats by...

    Nordstrom (NYSE:JWN): Q3 EPS of $0.59 beats by $0.06. Revenue of $2.48B (+14.2% Y/Y) beats by $300M. Guides FY11 EPS lower. Shares -3.4% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:11 PM | 1 Comment
  • ELOS

    Syneron Medical (ELOS +6%) holds on to solid gains after its Q3 came in better than expected...

    Syneron Medical (ELOS +6%) holds on to solid gains after its Q3 came in better than expected earlier today. Revenues were up 28.2% Y/Y, boosted by a surge in sales across all its business units. Profit from its Emerging Business Unit soared four-fold on new product launches.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:00 PM
  • COG

    Cabot Oil & Gas (COG +8%) rallies to the top of the S&P leader board and continues...

    Cabot Oil & Gas (COG +8%) rallies to the top of the S&P leader board and continues its run as 2011's top gainer among all S&P stocks - up 112% so far. COG's economics are best among oil plays followed by Brean Murray's Ray Deacon, noting "their (Marcellus) wells seem to keep getting better." His price target of $98/share may be "conservative," he says.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:55 PM
  • ATPAQ

    ATP Oil & Gas (ATPG -13%) tumbles for a second day after disclosing a 22% drop in...

    ATP Oil & Gas (ATPG -13%) tumbles for a second day after disclosing a 22% drop in production. Cutting shares to Reduce from Accumulate, Global Hunter cites expenditures that are likely to outpace its cash flow, and delays that will result in sharply lower production mean that the offshore explorer's leverage "continues to increase."

     
     
     
     
    | 3:38 PM
  • VIVO

    Meridian Bioscience (VIVO +2.6%) trades up despite its FQ4 earnings falling slightly short of...

    Meridian Bioscience (VIVO +2.6%) trades up despite its FQ4 earnings falling slightly short of analysts' estimates. Revenue rose a solid 16% Y/Y on an increase in European and global sales. The company also reaffirms FY12 guidance at the low end of its range, but in line with the Street's consensus view.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:37 PM
  • WRK

    Packaging manufacturer Rock-Tenn (RKT -2.6%) dips, despite an FQ4 that topped Street estimates....

    Packaging manufacturer Rock-Tenn (RKT -2.6%) dips, despite an FQ4 that topped Street estimates. Revenue fell 8.2% Y/Y as costs tied to plant closures overshadowed better core profit from recently acquired Smurfit-Stone Container.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:20 PM
  • STJ

    St. Jude Medical (STJ +2.7%) gains after presenting 30-day feasibility data on Portico, its...

    St. Jude Medical (STJ +2.7%) gains after presenting 30-day feasibility data on Portico, its catheter-delivered heart valve, which showed no major side effects.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:10 PM
  • CSCO

    Cisco's (CSCO +6%) FQ1 report (I, II, III) isn't exactly spawning a huge rally in networking...

    Cisco's (CSCO +6%) FQ1 report (I, II, III) isn't exactly spawning a huge rally in networking stocks, but a handful of names are outperforming in response. RVBD +3.8%. BRCD +3.4%. PKT +3.7%. JNPR +1.3%. BCSI +1.6%. PLCM +1.9%. (more on CSCO)

     
     
     
     
    | 3:04 PM
  • AAPL

    Rumors of cuts in iPhone and iPad (AAPL -2.7%) production are not as ominous as they sound,...

    Rumors of cuts in iPhone and iPad (AAPL -2.7%) production are not as ominous as they sound, Citi's Richard Gardner writes, seeing stock weakness as a "buying opportunity." The impact of Thailand's flooding is negligible, he says, and his checks indicate Thai partner Hon Hai should still deliver 32-33M iPhones this quarter, exceeding his estimate of 28M units. (also: I, II)
     
     
     
     
    | 2:46 PM
  • CNI

    Canadian National Railway (CNI +2.1%) trades higher after announcing an agreement with Coalspur...

    Canadian National Railway (CNI +2.1%) trades higher after announcing an agreement with Coalspur Mines (OTCPK:CSPZF) to develop a logistics supply chain for transporting thermal coal from Coalspur's Vista coal project in Alberta to Western Canadian ports starting in 2015.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:41 PM | 2 Comments
  • FF

    Chemical and biofuels maker FutureFuel (NYSE:FF) is up 10.2% after reporting Q3 revenue of...

    Chemical and biofuels maker FutureFuel (NYSE:FF) is up 10.2% after reporting Q3 revenue of $90.3M (+37% Y/Y) and EPS of $0.31; the latter beat consensus by $0.15. Surging biofuel sales (53% of total revenue) offset an 11% Y/Y decline in chemical sales.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:40 PM
  • GIII

    G-III Apparel (GIII -6.6%) trades lower on heavy volume, extending a selloff started yesterday...

    G-III Apparel (GIII -6.6%) trades lower on heavy volume, extending a selloff started yesterday after retailers selling the company's brands tip towards showing soft sales.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:40 PM
  • GRPN

    Groupon (GRPN +2.6%) is rallying a bit today after losing 14% of its value between its post-IPO...

    Groupon (GRPN +2.6%) is rallying a bit today after losing 14% of its value between its post-IPO open and Wednesday's close. As fund manager Todd Sullivan notes, Groupon's tiny float, along with a lack of options trading ability, could make shorting the stock a risky move over the near-term.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:28 PM
  • OAS

    Oasis Petroleum (OAS +3.4%) jumps after CapitalOne ups the stock to Buy on valuation, citing...

    Oasis Petroleum (OAS +3.4%) jumps after CapitalOne ups the stock to Buy on valuation, citing lower water disposal costs.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:23 PM
  • BKS

    Barnes & Noble (BKS +7.6%) is rallying hard for the second straight day; shares are now up...

    Barnes & Noble (BKS +7.6%) is rallying hard for the second straight day; shares are now up nearly 30% since the company unveiled its Nook Tablet on Tuesday. Short-covering is likely a factor (46.7% of float shorted as of Oct. 14), though it doesn't hurt that the Nook Tablet's impressive specs have calmed fears B&N would have no answer to Amazon's (NASDAQ:AMZN) Kindle Fire. (earlier)

     
     
     
     
    | 2:14 PM
  • NOG

    Northern Oil & Gas (NOG -2.4%) trades lower after Global Hunter cuts the shares to...

    Northern Oil & Gas (NOG -2.4%) trades lower after Global Hunter cuts the shares to Accumulate on valuation, citing the company's mixed Q3 results yesterday.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:11 PM | 4 Comments
  • VRTX

    Vertex Pharmaceuticals (VRTX +3.7%) jumps on a Morgan Stanley upgrade to Equalweight on...

    Vertex Pharmaceuticals (VRTX +3.7%) jumps on a Morgan Stanley upgrade to Equalweight on valuation. Morgan cites the company's solid pipeline, and adds that data on competitors in the hepatitis C treatment space could "systematically disappoint" on one or more major point groups, which would favor its own hepatitis drug Incivek.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:03 PM
  • SVNTQ

    Savient Pharmaceuticals (SVNT -6%) dips after JMP Securities cuts the shares to Market...

    Savient Pharmaceuticals (SVNT -6%) dips after JMP Securities cuts the shares to Market Underperform, citing limited growth potential for the company's gout treatment drug Krystexxa.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:41 PM
  • IVZ

    Invesco (IVZ +4.9%) pops after saying its AUM jumped 6.2% M/M to $635.7B as a result of the...

    Invesco (IVZ +4.9%) pops after saying its AUM jumped 6.2% M/M to $635.7B as a result of the markets recent recovery. The company adds that it expects flow trends will continue to improve, in spite of the challenging macro backdrop.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:27 PM

  • Stocks shoot to new highs for the day over the past moments, the DJIA +1.5%, the Nasdaq +0.7%....

    Stocks shoot to new highs for the day over the past moments, the DJIA +1.5%, the Nasdaq +0.7%. The euro starts to romp as well, +0.6% to $1.3627. Something brewing across the pond?
     
     
     
     
    | 1:19 PM

  • Oil marches higher, WTI crude taking out $98/barrel for the first time since mid-summer even as...

    Oil marches higher, WTI crude taking out $98/barrel for the first time since mid-summer even as most of the rest of the commodity complex sells off. Ahead of winter, heating oil is a few ticks from its highest level since the start of May. USO +2.2%. Heating oil ETF: UHN +2.3%.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:13 PM | 1 Comment
  • EGAN

    eGain (NASDAQ:EGAN), a provider of cloud-based customer support software, drops 17.9% after...

    eGain (NASDAQ:EGAN), a provider of cloud-based customer support software, drops 17.9% after reporting FQ1 revenue of $10.4M (-21% Y/Y) and EPS of $0.02; the latter missed consensus by $0.04. The company, which had surged on buyout hopes following Oracle's acquisition of competitor RightNow, is reaffirming its FY12 guidance.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:12 PM
  • JAGGF

    Jaguar Mining (JAG -1.6%) dips after its Q3 swings to a loss. FX losses in the Brazilian Real...

    Jaguar Mining (JAG -1.6%) dips after its Q3 swings to a loss. FX losses in the Brazilian Real plus higher operational costs weighed on the company's bottom line, offsetting higher core profits from a 44% surge gold sales.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:03 PM
  • HII

    Shipbuilder Huntington Ingalls (HII +6%) gains on a better than expected Q3 earnings report. EPS...

    Shipbuilder Huntington Ingalls (HII +6%) gains on a better than expected Q3 earnings report. EPS easily beat estimates, but revenue actually swung to a $4.3% Y/Y loss, due primarily to impairment charges and lower sales due to cuts in Pentagon spending.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:44 PM
  • DXC

    The bears aren't done yet with Computer Sciences (CSC -8%), as shares tumble again after...

    The bears aren't done yet with Computer Sciences (CSC -8%), as shares tumble again after yesterday's 15% drubbing. The IT outsourcing firm is heavily dependent upon government contracts, and warnings that federal budget constraints are reducing public sector demand shake CSC investors. JPMorgan Chase downgrades shares to Underweight from Neutral.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:20 PM
  • QSR

    AFC Enterprises (AFCE +14.9%) - operator of the Popeyes restaurant chain - gains after its Q3...

    AFC Enterprises (AFCE +14.9%) - operator of the Popeyes restaurant chain - gains after its Q3 beats EPS estimates, largely due to its buyback program leaving fewer shares outstanding. Earnings actually fell 1.7% Y/Y on higher costs. The company also lifts its FY11 earnings forecast, now expecting to earn between $0.93 - $0.97 per share, up from its earlier projection of $0.91 - $0.95.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:17 PM
  • TSM

    TSMC (TSM +1.8%) is trading higher after reporting its October sales rose 12.6% M/M. DigiTimes...

    TSMC (TSM +1.8%) is trading higher after reporting its October sales rose 12.6% M/M. DigiTimes adds TSMC has seen a 20%+ jump in orders from QCOM, NVDA, SPRD, and Mediatek. The numbers suggest TSMC could beat its Q4 guidance (though December tends to be weak), and that chip demand could be stabilizing after getting hit hard by inventory corrections. (earlier) (UMC sales)

     
     
     
     
    | 12:06 PM
  • MWW

    Staffing company stocks push higher after initial jobless claims hit a 7-month low - even...

    Staffing company stocks push higher after initial jobless claims hit a 7-month low - even helping to provide a lift to the shares of online employment-related firms Monster Worldwide (MWW +2.7%) and Dice Holding (DHX +1.8%). Advancers: KFRC 6.2%, BBSI +4.9%, KELYA +2.9%, RHI +3.1%.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:56 AM
  • AMCX

    AMC Networks' (AMCX +3.2%) shares climb after the cable TV network company reports Q3 EPS...

    AMC Networks' (AMCX +3.2%) shares climb after the cable TV network company reports Q3 EPS of $0.55 vs. $0.47 consensus, up 58% Y/Y, while $284M in revenue was up 4.6% Y/Y but below $292M consensus. CEO Josh Sapan says AMC will continue to invest in original programming such as The Walking Dead and Mad Men.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:50 AM
  • HOS

    Hornbeck Offshore (HOS +4.3%) gains after saying it was increasing its 6.75M share offering to...

    Hornbeck Offshore (HOS +4.3%) gains after saying it was increasing its 6.75M share offering to 7M due to heavy demand, and had priced it at $30, only a slight discount to Wednesday's close. The company is using the funds to build 16 new-generation offshore supply vessels, with an option to build an additional 16.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:41 AM
  • AGN

    Shares of Watson Pharmaceuticals (WPI -0.1%) and Teva Pharmaceuticals (TEVA -1.5%) could see...

    Shares of Watson Pharmaceuticals (WPI -0.1%) and Teva Pharmaceuticals (TEVA -1.5%) could see volatility with a breaking Bloomberg report indicating that a court has approved Watson to sell a generic version of Seasonique - denying Teva's bid to stop the firm from selling the oral contraceptive.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:36 AM
  • CSCO

    More analyst commentary on Cisco (CSCO +6.1%): Deutsche and Raymond James are joining Citi in...

    More analyst commentary on Cisco (CSCO +6.1%): Deutsche and Raymond James are joining Citi in upgrading the company post-earnings. Raymond believes the price pressure seen lately by Cisco is softening, and also thinks GOOG's acquisition of MMI could give Cisco's cable business a lift. But others aren't quite so bullish. (more) (transcript)

     
     
     
     
    | 11:31 AM
  • ANW

    Aegean Marine Petroleum Network (OTC:ANW +10.5%) pops after its Q3 easily beat estimates late...

    Aegean Marine Petroleum Network (OTC:ANW +10.5%) pops after its Q3 easily beat estimates late yesterday. Core results were stronger than expected, as a 37% jump in Y/Y revenue helped to offset a write-down on the sale of one of its ships. Separately, Dahlman Rose upgrades the shares to Buy on the back of the report.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:15 AM
  • TTWO

    Take-Two Interactive (TTWO -6.2%), whose shares outperformed yesterday after delivering weak...

    Take-Two Interactive (TTWO -6.2%), whose shares outperformed yesterday after delivering weak guidance to go with mixed FQ2 results, is tanking today after announcing a $200M convertible debt offering. Take-Two says it will use the proceeds for "general corporate purposes," possibly including acquisitions. The company ended September with $269.7M in cash and equivalents, and $111.3M in debt.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:00 AM
  • KSS

    Kohl's (KSS -2.1%) gains after its Q3 EPS beats estimates. Profit rose 20% on continued sales...

    Kohl's (KSS -2.1%) gains after its Q3 EPS beats estimates. Profit rose 20% on continued sales growth as its focus on private and exclusive brands helped boost bottom line margins. The company also raises its FY guidance.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:55 AM
  • CSCO

    Most analysts are all aglow over Cisco's (CSCO +5.6%) second straight solid quarter after its...

    Most analysts are all aglow over Cisco's (CSCO +5.6%) second straight solid quarter after its spring warning of massive restructuring. But a few watchers advise tempering enthusiasm. Barclays believes it will take more than "beating a low bar" to move shares much higher, Lazard needs to see the restructuring effects over a longer term, and BofA isn't impressed with revenues.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:46 AM
  • MLCO

    Casino stocks trade lower - led by Melco Crown Entertainment (MPEL -10.1%) following its...

    Casino stocks trade lower - led by Melco Crown Entertainment (MPEL -10.1%) following its lukewarm Q3 report - extending a selloff that touched off yesterday. Kickstarting the negative sentiment was a report from Nevada's State Gaming Control Board showing casinos in the state reported 6% less profits Y/Y after high-stakes Asian Baccarat players stayed home. Decliners: LVS -3.6%, MGM -2.9%, WYNN -4.2%, BYD -2.2%.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:45 AM | 1 Comment
  • AAPL

    Apple (AAPL -2.3%) continues moving lower (previously) on account of a downbeat note from...

    Apple (AAPL -2.3%) continues moving lower (previously) on account of a downbeat note from Cleveland Research. The firm is cutting its iPad shipment estimates, citing competition from Amazon's (NASDAQ:AMZN) Kindle Fire. Amazon just lifted its 2011 orders for the Fire, which doesn't get put to the test by customers until next week.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:43 AM | 13 Comments
  • GLD

    Gold's pullback from the $1,800 level accelerates, the metal diving to $1,742 over the last few...

    Gold's pullback from the $1,800 level accelerates, the metal diving to $1,742 over the last few minutes. The move could suggest disappointment for those who hope the ECB will ride to Europe's rescue by opening the monetary spigots. GLD -1.5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:39 AM
  • AAP

    Advance Auto Parts (AAP +3.4%) is solidly higher after its Q3 beat estimates late yesterday....

    Advance Auto Parts (AAP +3.4%) is solidly higher after its Q3 beat estimates late yesterday. Profit rose 20% Y/Y as the parts retailer posted higher sales in its commercial line. The company also boosts its FY earnings outlook to $4.90 - $4.95 per share, above its prior view of $4.60 - $4.80.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:34 AM
  • GLBR

    FXCM is down 7.8% after reporting Q3 revenue of $109.1M (+20% Y/Y) and EPS of $0.23, missing...

    FXCM is down 7.8% after reporting Q3 revenue of $109.1M (+20% Y/Y) and EPS of $0.23, missing consensus by $1.2M and $0.02. In addition, the forex broker reported its retail customer trading volume (66% of total) fell 8% M/M in October, while its institutional trading volume (34% of total) grew 35%.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:32 AM

  • European shares give up gains and turn red as Italian bond yields turn north again. It's another...

    European shares give up gains and turn red as Italian bond yields turn north again. It's another run-of-the-mill volatile session on the continent, with indices down 3% early before reversing to nearly 2% higher shortly before stocks opened in the States. Stoxx 50 -0.1%.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:28 AM
  • PEGA

    Pegasystems (PEGA -21%) extends its losses after its Q3 results missed estimates late yesterday...

    Pegasystems (PEGA -21%) extends its losses after its Q3 results missed estimates late yesterday on a decline in new licenses deals.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:23 AM
  • OPNT-OLD

    Opnet (OPNT-OLD -21.6%) is tanking after delivering a weak FQ2 report. In addition to missing...

    Opnet (OPNT-OLD -21.6%) is tanking after delivering a weak FQ2 report. In addition to missing revenue forecasts, the telecom software firm guided for FQ3 revenue of $44M-$49M ($47.1M consensus) and EPS of $0.24-$0.36 ($0.29 consensus) - broad ranges that suggest uncertainty about future demand. With yesterday's close translating into a trailing P/E of 52, Opnet had little margin for error.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:18 AM
  • FLT

    FleetCor (NYSE:FLT) racks up a 5.7% gain after the firm shows a better-than-expected Q3 profit...

    FleetCor (NYSE:FLT) racks up a 5.7% gain after the firm shows a better-than-expected Q3 profit on revenue of $134M (+21% Y/Y). The specialty payment provider also upped its estimate for full-year EPS to a range of $2.08-$2.12, from prior guidance of $2.00-$2.05.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:07 AM
  • AAPL

    The technicians are keeping a close eye on Apple (AAPL -1.8%), with $390 apparently a key line...

    The technicians are keeping a close eye on Apple (AAPL -1.8%), with $390 apparently a key line in the sand as a close below brings the shares under their 50 day moving average and confirms a setup known as an "island top," with $355 the next target. Current price: $388.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:00 AM | 6 Comments
  • ENS

    EnerSys (ENS +14.5%) rockets higher after the firm lifts FQ3 EPS guidance to $0.67-$0.71 -...

    EnerSys (ENS +14.5%) rockets higher after the firm lifts FQ3 EPS guidance to $0.67-$0.71 - better than the consensus estimate from analysts of $0.61. The company also nabbed an upgrade from Mizuho to Buy from Neutral to help the positive momentum.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:58 AM
  • GMCR

    Unsurprisingly, some analysts are defending Green Mountain's (NASDAQ:GMCR) following its...

    Unsurprisingly, some analysts are defending Green Mountain's (NASDAQ:GMCR) following its post-earnings crash. Canaccord believes Green Mountain's current situation is similar to a May 2010 EPS shortfall from Hansen Natural (HANS), which was also attributed to distributor over-buying ahead of a price increase. KeyBanc, meanwhile, notes Keurig brewer sales remain strong. GMCR -30.7%. (more) (transcript)

     
     
     
     
    | 9:24 AM | 3 Comments
  • CJ

    Shares of C&J Energy Services (CJES) +9.7% premarket after announcing its Q3 revenue grew...

    Shares of C&J Energy Services (CJES) +9.7% premarket after announcing its Q3 revenue grew 26% Y/Y, primarily due to timely delivery and deployment of the company’s fifth hydraulic fracturing fleet. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 9:23 AM
  • KLIC

    Shares of Kulicke & Soffa (NASDAQ:KLIC) fall off 7.1% premarket after the firm steers FQ1...

    Shares of Kulicke & Soffa (NASDAQ:KLIC) fall off 7.1% premarket after the firm steers FQ1 guidance below the estimates of analysts after a global drop in personal computer shipments cuts into orders. The company says it will work to improve its cross-cyclical performance to help boost sagging revenue.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:11 AM
  • FRO
